text: Elze is a town in district of Hildesheim, in Lower Saxony, Germany. It is next to the river Leine, approximately 15 km (9.3 miles) west of Hildesheim. Elze is also one oldest city in the area, and its name comes from Latin : aula caesaris == Notable people == * Justus Gesenius (1601-1673), Lutheran theologian * Johann Heinrich Louis Krüger (1857-1923), mathematician * Philipp Furtwängler, (1800-1867), organ builder, * Philipp Furtwängler, (1869-1940), mathematician (number theorist) * Günter Halm, (born 1922), bearer of the Knight's Cross and Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany == Twin town == * Écouché, France since 1972 == References ==
title: Elze
